author: djrtwo
content: https://github.com/ethresearch/public-attacknets

author: protolambda
content: This is the beta version launch of the first attack-nets. Small, and more easy to attack, but with bounties! If you are new to all this, no problem, we are glad to help you with tooling and further explanation, to get you started attacking the testnet!

author: jgm
content: Worth adding ENR info or multiaddrs for the participating nodes?

author: protolambda
content: There's bootnode info to get started. We could add all nodes, or maybe just expect users to peer after running dv5 anyway. What do you think <@!291925846556540928> ?

author: jgm
content: Ah okay, would be nice to have it in the README (or at least referred to in the README)

content: Isn't part of the exercise having to determine what nodes are validating nodes?

author: djrtwo
content:
Looks like <@!604062686623432740> managed to crash discovery in lighthouse (without crashing the beacon node process/finality on the network)

Jonny will be getting an honorable mention for `lighthouse-attack-0` :)
